newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan dislikes excessive yen weakness, strength - MOF.
newsitem.headline: Japan dislikes excessive yen weakness, strength - MOF.

text.p: Japan does not welcome excessive weakness or strength in the yen, a senior official of the Ministry of Finance (MOF) told Reuters on Thursday.
"We do not welcome excessive yen weakness, just as we do not welcome excessive yen strength," the official said.
He added that Japan would continue to watch movements in currency markets closely.
Asked whether the Group of Seven (G7) nations shared the U.S.'s stance favouring a strong dollar, the official said: "The (G7) nations are cooperating in seeking stability in currencies."
He declined to comment on remarks made by Finance Minister Hiroshi Mitsuzuka on Wednesday that the G7 nations shared the U.S.'s stance on the dollar.

Mitsuzuka told a news conference on Wednesday that the G7 nations agree with the U.S. stance in favour of a strong dollar. "The U.S. has been saying that it is seeking a strong dollar. My understanding is that the G7 nations share that stance," Mitsuzuka said.
Asked to comment, the senior MOF official said on Thursday: "I do not know precisely what the minister said."
